name: Onboarding Allrounder
description:
Welcome to Wahoo X, we have hand picked these workouts for you to showcase the variety of what SYSTM has to offer, we hope you enjoy them!

​

All of our workouts are designed by our dedicated Sports Science team and each one has a unique purpose. The targets in these workouts are based on estimated values unless you have completed one of our fitness assessments so if the targets don’t feel quite right, complete the Half Monty fitness assessment to determine your FTP and MAP.

​

On top of cycling workouts, the Wahoo X library also includes other categories of content. If you would like to try some of these, here are some of of our recommendations:

1. [Shoulder & Upper Back Mobility A](https://systm.wahoofitness.com/content-details/WSQ9YJ4yRy)
2. [Basic Yoga Poses](https://systm.wahoofitness.com/content-details/qxs6YvzsoQ)
3. [Intro to the SYSTM Mental Training Program](https://systm.wahoofitness.com/content-details/YtFOky53SZ)

prospects.name: Ruta Chingaza
prospects.description:
🎬 Film (2020): In February, legendary ultra-endurance cyclist Lael Wilcox, Joe Cruz, and filmmaker Rugile Kaladyte traveled to the Colombian capital, in partnership with Conservation International, Wahoo, and Bikepacking.com to launch the Bikepacking for Conservation Program. The project was designed to explore and scout a bikepacking route that would connect the bustling metropolis of Bogota, Colombia with rural communities and the Chingaza National Park. The resulting route — Ruta Chingaza — will help cyclists connect to nature and better understand the ecosystems upon which life and livelihoods in this area depend.

​

🚴 Workout: The workout accompanying this film is a recovery session. Intensity is low, with power remaining at or below 50% of FTP (2.5 on a scale from 1 to 10) with heart rate targets entirely in Zone 1. The intensity and cadence targets will vary throughout this session to keep it interesting, but not so much that it distracts you from the story.

​

[Here's how to turn off on-screen graphics for the best viewing experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterInspiration)

prospects.name: Gran Canaria: Pico de las Nieves
prospects.description:
From the picturesque village of Tejeda today we’re heading to Pico de las Nieves for an unforgettable ride and workout to the summit of the island at 1,949m above sea level and the highest point on the island! After sampling Tejeda’s famous almond and dark chocolate cookies it’s time to hit the road for a block of 4 x 4 min low cadence with 1 min high cadence drills. Taking a moment to let that cookie settle and get back in the green we’ll follow this up with a short 3 min 30 second low cadence effort before our next block of low cadence / high cadence repeats, this time for 2 minute / 1 minute intervals. With the summit tantalisingly close and as the effort starts to take its toll we’re going to have to really focus on the road ahead as we build our effort towards Pico de las Nieves where by the summit we can well and truly say that we’ve conquered Gran Canaria!

​

This workout focusses on cadence work which helps with muscular endurance making it an efficient threshold session working at a variety of cadence targets.

​

[**Route on Strava**](https://www.strava.com/activities/8764050850)

​

_Your Host: There are few people who know the mountains and roads of Europe better than Wahoo Ambassador Michael Cotty. As founder of The Col Collective, Mike has made a career out of riding, filming, and telling the story of epic rides and mountains across the continent. As your On Location co-creator and host, Mike's engaging character, curious mind, and friendly nature will have you cueing up your next ride with him before you've even finished the cool-down._

prospects.name: Giro d'Italia 1
prospects.description:
**Featured Rider:** Attila Valter

**Event:** Giro d'Italia

**Mission:** It's the final stage of your first Grand Tour. For the past three weeks, you've battled your way across Italy. What better way to finish than leaving it all on the road in a final, short time trial. It's you against the clock in the race of truth.

​

**About ProRides**

If you’ve ever dreamed of being a professional cyclist, now’s your chance. The SYSTM ProRide series allows you to experience what it’s like to be in the biggest bike races in the world, thanks to the SYSTM 4DP® platform. We’ve taken the first-person camera footage and power data from a pro cyclist and analyzed it to determine which part of their 4DP® profile each of their efforts corresponds to. But since few of us can put down pro-level watts, we made it so all of the efforts are scaled to your own personal 4DP® profile. That means you get to experience exactly what the pros experience relative to your own abilities. When they sprint, you sprint. When they attack, you attack. When they sit up, you get to take it (relatively) easy. It's the most immersive, realistic race simulation out there.

​

[Here's some more information on how to create the most immersive ProRides experience.](https://wahoosystm.com/HelpCenterProRides)

​

**Featured Footage: **Velon

prospects.name: Catalunya: Costa Brava Coastline
prospects.description:
Today we’re going to be riding one of the most incredible roads of Spain's Catalan region, going from St Feliu de Guíxols over to Tossa de Mar and hugging the Costa Brava coastline the whole way. Continually undulating we’ll hit each of the eight rolling climbs hard, working at low cadence with high intensity to build strength. Mike will keep you focused on good form, though, and make sure you keep the power down on all the way over each summit.

​

It wouldn't be an On Location ride, though, if we didn't have a look at the scenic attractions along the way, though, so get ready for craggy rocks, turquoise clear waters, and a few opportunities to delve into the Costa Brava’s finest as we find out more about the region along this 21km route.

​

[Route on Strava](https://www.strava.com/routes/2967787441439728434)

​

_Your Host: There are few people who know the mountains and roads of Europe better than Wahoo Ambassador Michael Cotty. As founder of The Col Collective, Mike has made a career out of riding, filming, and telling the story of epic rides and mountains across the continent. As your On Location co-creator and host, Mike's engaging character, curious mind, and friendly nature will have you cueing up your next ride with him before you've even finished the cool-down._

prospects.name: What's Next?
prospects.description:
We hope you enjoyed these workouts and spend more time with us on SYSTM.

​

The Sports Science team uses 4DP to make each workout a customized and unique experience which is most beneficial to you. To make sure you are training with the most accurate targets and to ensure the best results, we highly recommend taking the Half Monty or Full Frontal fitness assessment. Here is a plan to help you take the test: [++https://wahoosystm.com/CyclingFitnessTestPrep++](https://wahoosystm.com/CyclingFitnessTestPrep)
